title: Region and Time Conversion
text: section, convert dataset containing GDP countries 17-region mapping WITCH model, 5-region mapping used SSP database. First, let’s create initial database, extract GDP 2005 default_weights. column names renamed. convention, column names must “iso3” “value” Now, using function convert_region, aggregate dataset country-level (ISO3) 17-region mapping WITCH model, available default mapping. final step, convert 17-region data 5-region SSP database. dataset first disaggregated iso3 level aggregated 5 regions, automatically.
code: library(data.table) library(witchtools)  # Creation of the initial dataset # Note the column names: iso3 and value gdp_iso3 <- copy(default_weights[['gdp']]) setnames(gdp_iso3,'weight','value') gdp_iso3 #> Index: <value> #>        iso3        value #>      <char>        <num> #>   1:    AFG 7.543866e+01 #>   2:    ALB 3.861787e+01 #>   3:    DZA 4.673124e+02 #>   4:    AGO 1.979695e+02 #>   5:    ARG 8.905475e+02 #>  ---                     #> 246:    BLM 1.000000e-10 #> 247:    CYM 1.000000e-10 #> 248:    KNA 1.000000e-10 #> 249:    MAF 1.000000e-10 #> 250:    MSR 1.000000e-10 # Aggregate value at WITCH regional scale (17 regions) gdp_witch17 <- convert_region(gdp_iso3, to_reg = 'witch17') gdp_witch17 #>         witch17      value #>          <char>      <num> #>  1:        laca  3811.0076 #>  2:       sasia  2616.5509 #>  3:         ssa  3281.0841 #>  4:      europe 22137.4325 #>  5:        mena  7253.0736 #>  6:          te  8156.9139 #>  7:     oceania  1501.8456 #>  8:      brazil  2969.7366 #>  9:      seasia  4873.5174 #> 10:      canada  1746.1213 #> 11:       china 22961.7494 #> 12:   indonesia  3118.3992 #> 13:       india  8377.0372 #> 14:      jpnkor  7243.6577 #> 15:      mexico  2300.2179 #> 16:         usa 19910.1964 #> 17: southafrica   749.2962 # Aggregate value at WITCH regional scale (17 regions) gdp_r5 <- convert_region(gdp_witch17, to_reg = 'r5') gdp_r5 #>        r5     value #>    <char>     <num> #> 1:  r5lam  8973.866 #> 2: r5oecd 52788.486 #> 3: r5asia 44228.718 #> 4:  r5maf 11283.454 #> 5:  r5ref  5733.314

title: Region and Time Conversion
text: section, convert yearly time-serie default time period WITCH model, 5 year-periods 2005 2150, using function convert_time_period. function convert_time_period can also extrapolate missing periods.
code: # Time-serie dd <- data.table(tech = c("tech1","tech2"), year = 2005:2050, value = 1:46)  # Aggregate values to the default WITCH time period mapping res <- convert_time_period(dd, 't30') print(nrow(res)) #> [1] 20 print(res, nrows = 20) #>       tech      t value #>     <char> <char> <num> #>  1:  tech1      1     2 #>  2:  tech2      1     2 #>  3:  tech2      2     6 #>  4:  tech1      2     6 #>  5:  tech1      3    11 #>  6:  tech2      3    11 #>  7:  tech2      4    16 #>  8:  tech1      4    16 #>  9:  tech1      5    21 #> 10:  tech2      5    21 #> 11:  tech2      6    26 #> 12:  tech1      6    26 #> 13:  tech1      7    31 #> 14:  tech2      7    31 #> 15:  tech2      8    36 #> 16:  tech1      8    36 #> 17:  tech1      9    41 #> 18:  tech2      9    41 #> 19:  tech2     10    45 #> 20:  tech1     10    45 #>       tech      t value # Aggregate values to the default WITCH time period mapping with extrapolation res <- convert_time_period(dd, 't30', do_extrap = TRUE) print(nrow(res)) #> [1] 60 print(tail(res)) #>      tech      t value #>    <char> <char> <num> #> 1:  tech2     25    46 #> 2:  tech2     26    46 #> 3:  tech2     27    46 #> 4:  tech2     28    46 #> 5:  tech2     29    46 #> 6:  tech2     30    46

title: Authors and Citation
text: Laurent Drouet. Author, maintainer. Johannes Emmerling. Author. Giacomo Marangoni. Contributor. Pietro Andreoni. Contributor. Lara Aleluia Reis. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Drouet L, Emmerling J (2024). witchtools: Data Management Integrated Assessment Models. R package version 0.4.10, http://witchtools.witchmodel.org.
code: @Manual{,   title = {witchtools: Data Management for Integrated Assessment Models},   author = {Laurent Drouet and Johannes Emmerling},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.4.10},   url = {http://witchtools.witchmodel.org}, }

title: Data Management for IAMs
text: witchtools provides toolkit manage data integrated assessment models. witchtools part tool ecosystem WITCH model. package makes possible easily transparently reproduce data processing raw data, data used model results uploaded IAMC database. package developed WITCH model, already used simply process data uses models.

title: Data Management for IAMs
text: Conversion yearly time series time-period (including possible decision tree structure) based time series. Conversion data one regional mapping another one. Default time-period mappings, regional mappings aggregation weights used WITCH model Batch conversion make_data files input directory WITCH model Easy access witch-team/witch-data repository

title: Data Management for IAMs
Data Management for IAMs
code: library(witchtools)  # Convert from 17 WITCH regions to the 5 SSP regions  gdp_r5 <- convert_region(gdp_witch17, to_reg = 'r5')  # Convert from yearly to the WITCH time perdios dd_t30 <- convert_region(dd_year, time_mapping = 't30')  # for WITCH user: Generate input data of the WITCH model witch_translate_data(region = 'witch17', timescale = 't30')

what: Batch convert parameters and variables from a GDX — convert_gdx
title: Batch convert parameters and variables from a GDX — convert_gdx
text: convert_gdx writes converted GDX output_directory. parameters variables input gdxfile converted using convert_table function. Specific conversion options read parameter meta_param also stored gdxfile.

title: Batch convert parameters and variables from a GDX — convert_gdx
code: convert_gdx(   gdxfile,   reg_id,   time_id,   output_directory,   region_mappings = region_mappings,   time_mappings = time_mappings,   weights = witchtools::default_weights,   guess_input_t = "t30",   region_name = NULL,   guess_region = "witch17",   default_agg_missing = "zero",   default_meta_param = NULL )

title: Batch convert parameters and variables from a GDX — convert_gdx
text: gdxfile location GDX file. reg_id final regional aggregation. time_id final time_period aggregation. output_directory directory write converted GDX region_mappings named list region mapping data.table. time_mappings named list time mapping data.table. weights named list weights used convert_region guess_input_t input time mapping explicitely defined region_name column name region, reg_id null guess_region input regional mapping explicitely defined default_agg_missing default parameter handle missing values convert_region default_meta_param default meta_param

title: Batch convert parameters and variables from a GDX — convert_gdx

what: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
text: convert_region returns list containing data.table values converted one regional mapping another. conversion done downscaling values country-level (necessary) updscaling final regional mapping. list also contain optional data.table value coperture operator sumby. required format input data described Details.

title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
code: convert_region(   .x,   from_reg = NULL,   to_reg,   agg_operator = "sum",   agg_weight = witchtools::default_weights[["gdp"]],   agg_missing = "NA",   regions = witchtools::region_mappings,   info = FALSE )

title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
text: .x well-formatted data.table. from_reg initial regional mapping name data.table mapping. to_reg final regional mapping name  data.table mapping. agg_operator aggregation operator (See Details list possible values) agg_weight aggregation weight data.table (See Details list possible values) agg_missing tells deal missing values ("NA" "zero") regions optional list region mappings (see Details format) info logical indicating whether include information, required agg_operator "sumby".

title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
text: list containing converted data.table information coperture available.

title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region
text: input data.table contain column "value" column named initial regional mapping from_reg, columns considered id columns. resulting data.table column named final regional mapping to_reg. regional mapping from_reg to_reg can provided named list parameter regions. Regional mappings 2-columns data.table column named 'iso3' (country ISO3) another one named regional mapping (region name). name list also regional mapping name.

title: Convert a data.table from a regional mapping to another. — convert_region

what: Batch convert tables from a SQLite database — convert_sqlite
title: Batch convert tables from a SQLite database — convert_sqlite
text: convert_sqlite writes converted SQLite database output_directory. tables input sqlitedb converted using convert_table function. Specific conversion options read parameter meta_param also stored sqlitedb.

title: Batch convert tables from a SQLite database — convert_sqlite
code: convert_sqlite(   sqlitedb,   reg_id,   time_id,   output_directory,   region_mappings = witchtools::region_mappings,   time_mappings = witchtools::time_mappings,   weights = witchtools::default_weights,   guess_input_t = "t30",   region_name = NULL,   guess_region = "witch17",   default_agg_missing = "NA",   default_meta_param = NULL )

title: Batch convert tables from a SQLite database — convert_sqlite
text: sqlitedb SQLITE file. reg_id final regional aggregation. time_id final time_period aggregation. output_directory directory write converted SQLITE DB region_mappings named list region mapping data.table. time_mappings named list time mapping data.table. weights named list weights used convert_region guess_input_t input time mapping explicitely defined region_name column name region, reg_id null guess_region input regional mapping explicitely defined default_agg_missing default parameter handle missing values convert_region default_meta_param default meta_param

title: Batch convert tables from a SQLite database — convert_sqlite

what: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table
title: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table
text: convert_table returns list containing data.table values converted years time periods one regional mapping another. function calling convert_time_period convert_region. details parameters functions. input table might data.table data.frame contain column "value". others columns considered indices.

title: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table
code: convert_table(   .x,   ...,   options = list(),   time_mapping = NULL,   from_reg = NULL,   to_reg = NULL,   agg_weight = NULL,   regions = NULL,   do_time_period = TRUE,   do_region = TRUE,   info = FALSE )

title: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table
text: .x well-formatted data.table. ... parameters send convert_region convert_time_period. options list parameters send convert_region convert_time_period. time_mapping time mapping data.table. from_reg initial regional mapping name data.table mapping. to_reg final regional mapping name  data.table mapping. agg_weight aggregation weight data.table regions optional list region mappings (see Details format) do_time_period logical indicating whether years converted. do_region logical indicating whether region converted. info logical indicating whether include information, necessary agg_operator "sumby".

title: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table
text: data.table list containing converted data.table information coperture available.

title: Convert time periods and regions in a table. — convert_table

what: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
text: convert_time_period returns formatted data.table aggregating values years time periods. required format input data described Details.

title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
code: convert_time_period(   .x,   time_mapping,   do_interp = FALSE,   do_extrap = FALSE,   do_past_extrap = FALSE,   year_name = "year",   value_name = "value",   time_aggregate = "mean",   na.rm = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
text: .x well-formatted data.table. time_mapping time mapping data.table. do_interp logical indicating whether linear interpolation done. do_extrap logical indicating whether constant extrapolation done. do_past_extrap logical indicating whether constant extrapolation done past value. year_name string column name year. value_name string column name value. time_aggregate function aggregate yearly values ("mean","sum","max"). na.rm logical indicating whether missing values removed. verbose logical indicating whether running verbose mode.

title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
text: converted data.table

title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
text: input data.table contain columns "year" "value", columns considered id columns. resulting data.table column "t" instead "year. Note period, year value column names can specified. time mapping year time period provided data.table columns "year" "t", refyear interpolation extrapolation. case missing periods, can linearly interpolated constantly interpolated. several years mapped period, values averaged function fun.aggregate used.

title: Convert a data.table from year to time period. — convert_time_period
code: library(data.table)  # original data.table dd <- data.table(year = 2005:2050, value = 1:46)  # Convert yearly time-serie into time period convert_time_period(dd, "t30") #>          t value #>     <char> <num> #>  1:      1     2 #>  2:      2     6 #>  3:      3    11 #>  4:      4    16 #>  5:      5    21 #>  6:      6    26 #>  7:      7    31 #>  8:      8    36 #>  9:      9    41 #> 10:     10    45

title: Default weights. — default_weights
text: collection country-level Statistics used weights regional disaggregation/aggregation. Values given 250 ISO3.

title: Default weights. — default_weights
Default weights. — default_weights
text: list data.table: pop Population 2005 gdp GDP 2005 co2 CO2 FFI 2005 extr_coal_2000 Coal extraction 2000 extr_gas_2000 Gas extraction 2000 extr_oil_2000 Oil extraction 2000 tpes_2005 TPES 2005 prodelec_2005 Electricity production 2005 prodelec_hydro_2005 Electricity production hydroplants 2005 extr_oil_gas_2000 Extraction oil gas 2000 forest Forest cover land Forest cover cst constant

title: Default weights. — default_weights
text: https://tntcat.iiasa.ac./SspDb, https://www.pik-potsdam.de/paris-reality-check/primap-hist/, http://cait.wri.org/, https://www.iea.org/reports/world-energy-outlook-2018, https://databank.worldbank.org/source/world-development-indicators

title: Fast query of WITCH results files — witch_query
text: item parameter variable name resgdx list WITCH results gdx filter named list filter (eg. list(e="CO2",n="brazil,usa")). n contains "world", sum n computed. scenarios vector scenario names order resgdx add_year convert t year keep_gdx keep gdx file name result keep_t keep t result year_mapping mapping table translate t year ... additional parameters send batch_extract scen_table conversion function mapping table translate gdx scenario name

what: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
title: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
text: witch_translate_data generates input data WITCH model. First, run R make_data_files gams make_data_files usually located input folder WITCH. make_data_files produce gdx sqlite files build folder. Time-series yearly. Spatial data preferably described ISO3 level, script handle regional-mapping contained regions.

title: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
code: witch_translate_data(   witch_dir = ".",   region,   timescale,   idir = NULL,   output_dir = NULL,   regions = region_mappings,   times = time_mappings,   force = FALSE )

title: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
text: witch_dir WITCH main directory region final regional aggregation timescale final timescale aggregation idir input data folder (weights pass make_data files) output_dir output folder (overidde default WITCH data folder name) regions optional list regional mappings (see Details format) times optional list timescale mappings (see Details format) force logical indicating whether make files processed

title: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
text: regional mappings provided named list parameter regions. Regional mappings 2-columns data.table column named 'iso3' (country ISO3) another one named regional mapping (region name). name list also regional mapping name. times list time mapping year time period provided data.table columns "year" "t", refyear interpolation extrapolation. times contain timescale

title: Translate WITCH data (run make_data files and convert data). — witch_translate_data
